data.title: Sondhi demands repeal of controversial MOU44, urges Cabinet review
data.description: Ex-PAD leader claims ‘treacherous agreement’ violates the constitution and threatens Thailand’s sovereignty over Ko Kut in Trat

data.title: Naked ambition: Russian tourist’s ambitious swim results in rescue
data.description: The tourist’s midnight swim took a wild turn when he was found naked and exhausted, drifting halfway between Pattaya and Koh Lan

data.description: Arrested foreigners include staff of well-known TukTuk Patrol channel

data.title: Royal Enfield strengthens commitment to APAC region with the inauguration of new assembly plant in Thailand
data.description: Bangkok, December 04, 2024:: Royal Enfield, global leader in mid-size (250cc-750cc) motorcycle segment, today began a new chapter in its journey in the Asia Pacific region, with the commencement of operations of its new CKD(Completely Knocked down) assembly facility in Thailand.

data.title: Former protest leader sets deadline for govt to scrap MoU with Cambodia
data.description: A group led by former yellow-shirt protest leader  Sondhi Limthongkul  arrived at Government House’s complaint centre in Bangkok on Monday and demanded the government scrap its 2001 memorandum of understanding (MoU) with  Cambodia  or face  demonstrations .

data.title: Youth Unite to Inspire and Support Society
data.description: In a heartfelt display of youthful compassion, talented young performers from across Thailand are coming together for the charity performance Aladdin 2024. Scheduled for Sunday, 15th December 2024, at Chiang Mai University Convention Centre, the production aims to raise funds for underprivileged and orphaned youth.

data.title: Young singer died of blood poisoning after massages
data.description: UDON THANI - A  young singer who died  after three sessions at a local  massage  parlour that included  neck twisting  had died from  blood poisoning  and an autopsy is needed to determine the actual facts of her death, the provincial health chief said on Monday.

data.title: Central Chidlom’s grand renovation | The Nation in Brief
data.description: Central Chidlom’s grand renovation is more than just a facelift—it’s a masterclass in retail strategy. As Thailand’s most consistently high-performing department store, Central Chidlom's transformation is poised to reinforce its status as a world-class luxury destination.

data.title: Starbucks Reserve™  One Bangkok | The Nation Lifestyle
data.description: Today, we’re thrilled to present the unveiling of Starbucks' newest Flagship Store and its largest Greener Store at One Bangkok, a prestigious location in the heart of the city.

data.title: Contractor loses millions for abandoning Trang terminal project
data.description: Airports Department seizes 53-million-baht security deposit after contractor abandons construction, will search for a replacement soon to meet March deadline

data.title: Mitr Phol Group recognized with the Human Rights Award for the 5th consecutive year
data.description: Highlighting its commitment to conducting business in alignment with international human rights principles

data.title: Phillip Securities acquires RHB, boosting revenue 50%, offering 20 markets.
data.description: Phillip Securities Thailand has closed a major deal to acquire RHB Securities Thailand, strengthening its stock brokerage business. The merger is expected to boost revenue by more than 50% while expanding services and client base amid challenging conditions in Thailand's capital market.

data.title: Booming industries, skills gaps sparking Thai talent war: survey
data.description: Annual salary survey by Robert Walters says demand is highest in food manufacturing, fast-moving consumer goods, and automotive sectors

data.title: 23 Thais still in Syria, people rejoice as Assad flees
data.description: A number of Thai citizens in Syria have decided to stay in that country to evaluate the situation before deciding whether they would return home.

data.title: Bangkok’s latest green lung unveiled at govt complex festival
data.description: Chaeng Watthana invites public to sample new sky parks at D Garden Food & Music festival every Friday through December

data.title: Atta Gallery presents intersecting worlds
data.description: Our environment and the events surrounding us have served as a wellspring of inspiration for two veteran female artists from two countries during "Intersection: Where Two Paths Meet", which is running at Atta Gallery until Jan 12.

data.title: Bangkok expressways free on Tuesday to cut costs, holiday traffic
data.description: Toll fees on three expressways waived for Constitution Day amid expected travel surge

data.title: Foreigners, Thais arrested for making, selling pornography
data.description: Four foreign men and three Thais have been arrested on charges of making sex videos in Thailand that were sold worldwide.

data.title: Increase in unemployment likely in early 2025, expert says
data.description: Advisory Council for National Workforce Development chairman says stagnant economy is still forcing businesses to reduce their workforce

data.title: 'Humans to blame' for devastating floods in Northern Thailand
data.description: Flooding  has devasted many parts of Thailand this year.

data.title: Bankers review PM’s performance in first 100 days
data.description: While generally giving Paetongtarn a positive review, the two bankers make recommendations for further reviving the economy

data.title: Celebrate the Season at Moxy Bangkok Ratchaprasong
data.description: Ring in the festive season at Moxy Bangkok Ratchaprasong, the first and largest Moxy hotel in Asia-Pacific, nestled in Bangkok’s lively shopping district. With exclusive Christmas and New Year’s Eve events, along with exciting weekend activities and seasonal promotions, Moxy is the perfect destination for a celebration filled with fun, flavour, and entertainment.

data.title: Exhausted Russian found naked in sea off Pattaya
data.description: PATTAYA - An exhausted, naked Russian man has been rescued from the sea by a Koh Lan-bound speedboat driver about six kilometres off Pattaya.

data.title: Chinese visitors to Thailand between January-November top 6 million
data.description: Total foreign tourist arrivals exceed 32 million in first 11 months of 2024 with revenue reaching 1.5 trillion baht

data.title: ONE Championship’s Qatar return set to see Shamil Gasanov fight Martin Nguyen
data.description: Shamil Gasanov is set to fight former ONE Championship featherweight MMA champion Martin Nguyen in Qatar on February 20.

data.title: Singaporean dies after massage on Phuket beach
data.description: PHUKET - A Singaporean vacationing in Phuket has died shortly after a lengthy body massage at Patong beach, in Kathu district, police said.

data.title: The season of giving
data.description: From traditional treats to a local twist, Guru By Bangkok Post rounds up the best holiday hampers to make someone’s day.

data.title: River City Bangkok Celebrates 40 Years of Artistic Excellence
data.description: With a storied history that has shaped Thailand’s art scene and elevated it to global prominence,  River City Bangkok  celebrated its 40th anniversary on December 3, 2024, with the grand event  “40 Years of Magnificent Art and Antiques.”  The occasion highlighted the enduring achievements of this iconic centre for art and culture, a gateway that has tirelessly championed and supported artistic excellence.

data.title: Myanmar Embassy in Thailand denies 1,800-baht slip fee for 2-year work permit
data.description: The Myanmar Embassy in Thailand announced that it is not true that a slip fee of 1,800 baht must be paid to the embassy to apply for a two-year temporary work permit.

data.title: Ed Sheeran's Himalayan Adventure: First international star to perform in Bhutan
data.description: Music sensation Ed Sheeran is set to make history with an extraordinary performance in the Land of Thunder Dragon. The Grammy-winning artist has chosen the mystical kingdom of Bhutan as the opening destination for his 2025 Mathematics Tour in Asia and the Middle East.

data.title: US to work with partners in Syria to manage risk after Assad toppled, Biden says
data.description: WASHINGTON: The United States will work with partners and stakeholders in Syria to help seize the opportunity that has presented itself after rebel fighters

data.title: Kritchanya triumphs in playoff to secure double titles at 4th JAT-NB3 Elite Series
data.description: The highly determined Kritchanya Kaopattanasakul produced a crucial birdie to edge out Pimpakorn Panyadilok in a nerve-wracking playoff, clinching victories in both the Girls’ A-Class and the Open category as the fourth JAT-NB3 Elite Series concluded at Lotus Valley Golf Resort on Sunday.
